meanings.definition: The quality or state of being reticent.
meanings.sent1: Her reticences in sharing personal details made her a mysterious figure.
meanings.sent2: His reticences about his past only added to the air of secrecy around him.
meanings.sent3: Despite his reticences, his eyes sparkled with hidden stories waiting to be told.
meanings.sent4: The reticences of the old house whispered of forgotten secrets in every creak.
meanings.sent5: The reticences of the forest at night filled the air with an eerie silence.

meanings.definition: The act of withholding information or feelings.
meanings.sent1: Her reticences in the meeting left everyone wondering what she was hiding.
meanings.sent2: His reticences during the interview made it hard for the panel to gauge his true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's reticences about the broken vase were evident from the guilty look on its face.
meanings.sent4: The reticences of the closed book hinted at a story too painful to share.
meanings.sent5: The reticences of the storm clouds foretold a downpour of emotions.

meanings.sent1: His reticences in social gatherings often made him appear aloof.
meanings.sent2: Her reticences in class made it hard for the teacher to assess her understanding.
meanings.sent3: The reticences of the shy child melted away when she found a kindred spirit.
meanings.sent4: The reticences of the mountain range stood tall and silent against the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The reticences of the moonlit night enveloped the world in a peaceful hush.
